Chess Engine¶

This is the engine file, which contains the classes GameState and Move.

GameState¶

chess_engine.GameState.make_move(self, move)¶

The method that actual moves the pieces on the board, doesn’t work for special moves like castling

Parameters:

move – The move that needs to be made.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.undo_move(self)¶

Undoes the move.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.all_moves(self)¶

All the possible moves, within the rules of chess.

Returns:

The array holding the moves made.

Valid Moves¶

chess_engine.GameState.pawn_move(self, r: int, c: int, moves: list)¶

The valid moves a pawn can make.

Parameters:

  • r – The number representing the row.

  • c – The number representing the column.

  • moves – The array holding all the moves.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.knight_move(self, r: int, c: int, moves: list)¶

The valid moves a knight can make

Parameters:

  • r – The number representing the row.

  • c – The number representing the column.

  • moves – The array holding all the moves.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.rook_move(self, r: int, c: int, moves: list)¶

The valid moves a rook can make.

Parameters:

  • r – The number representing the row.

  • c – The number representing the column.

  • moves – The array holding all the moves.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.bishop_move(self, r: int, c: int, moves: list)¶

The valid moves a bishop can make

Parameters:

  • r – The number representing the row.

  • c – The number representing the column.

  • moves – The array holding all the moves.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.queen_move(self, r: int, c: int, moves: list)¶

The valid moves a queen can make

Parameters:

  • r – The number representing the row.

  • c – The number representing the column.

  • moves – The array holding all the moves.

Returns:

chess_engine.GameState.king_move(self, r: int, c: int, moves: list)¶

The valid moves a king can make

Parameters:

  • r – The number representing the row.

  • c – The number representing the column.

  • moves – The array holding all the moves.

Returns:

Move¶

chess_engine.Move.get_chess_notation(self)¶

Just gets the chess notation, or close to it, of a move.

Returns:

Chess
